title: (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (European
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (European 
Supervisory Authority (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions 
Authority)) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (european supervisory authority (european insurance occupational pension authority)) regulation 2022

title: (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 2. The Pensions Act 1990 (No. 25 of 1990) is amended by the insertion of
text_raw:
2. The Pensions Act 1990 (No. 25 of 1990) is amended by the insertion of 

the following sections after section 54: 

“Provision of information by trustees of scheme or trust RAC in 
respect of certain stress-tests 

54A. (1) Where the Pensions Authority is requested by EIOPA under 
the Regulation of 2010 to coordinate the carrying out of a stress-test 
referred to in that Regulation, the Pensions Authority shall – 

(a) 

consider which schemes or trust RACs are to carry out the 
stress-test having had regard to the request made by 
EIOPA, and 

(b) 

request the trustees of any scheme or trust RAC to – 

(i) 

carry out any such stress-test, and 

(ii) provide the Pensions Authority with information 
concerning the results of that stress-test by a date 
specified in the request. 

(2) The trustees of a scheme or trust RAC referred to in paragraph 
(b) of subsection (1) shall comply with the request made under that 
paragraph. 

(3) 

In this section and in section 54B, ‘Regulation of 2010’ means 
Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 24 November 2010 establishing a European Supervisory 
Authority (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority), 
amending Decision No 716/2009/EC and repealing Commission 
Decision 2009/79/EC. 

1 OJ No. L 331, 15.12.2010, p.48 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [514] 3 

(4) A word or expression that is used in this section or in section 
54B has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same meaning in this 
section or in section 54B as it has in the Regulation of 2010. 

Provision of information generally by trustees of scheme or trust 
RAC 

54B. (1) Where the Pensions Authority is requested by EIOPA under 
the Regulation of 2010 to provide EIOPA with information referred to in 
that Regulation, the Pensions Authority shall – 

(a) 

(b) 

consider which schemes or trust RACs are to provide 
information having had regard to the request made by 
EIOPA, and 

request the trustees of any such scheme or trust RAC to 
provide the Pensions Authority with the information it 
requires by a date specified in the request. 

(2) The trustees of a scheme or trust RAC referred to in paragraph 
(b) of subsection (1) shall comply with the request made under that 
paragraph.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 October, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [514]

title: (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Pensions Act 1990 to provide that the Pensions 
Authority may, on foot of a request from the European Insurance and 
Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), request the trustees of schemes and 
trust RACs to – 

• 

• 

carry out stress-tests and provide information to the Pensions 
Authority on the results of such stress-tests, and 

provide information to the Pensions Authority it requires in the 
context of any request by EIOPA under Regulation (EU) No 
1094/2010. 

These Regulations also impose obligations on trustees to comply with any such 
request made by the Pensions Authority. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [514] 5
